newsitem.title: CROATIA: Zagreb bourse says to list Varazdinska Banka.
newsitem.headline: Zagreb bourse says to list Varazdinska Banka.

text.p: Croatia's central bourse said on Tuesday it had approved listing in the top stock bracket of two Varazdinska Banka series from next week.

"We are listing Varazdinska first series ordinaries and second series bearer stock," spokesman Zeljko Kardum told Reuters, confirming market rumours of imminent expansion with new fully-listed issues.
Actual trade would begin next Tuesday.
So far, only drugs firm Pliva and Zagrebacka Banka have met strict disclosure and other bourse criteria created in line with listing proceedings of the London Stock Exchange.
But Varazdinska said earlier it now also had approval to put its outstanding shares on the market alongside the current blue chips.
It has 10,000 ordinary shares, issued at 16,000 kuna each, and 30,000 preferred shares with a face value of 500 kuna, said the head of its assets and investment banking sector, Niko Lukic.

One first series share in Varazdinska fetched 42,000 kuna in an isolated deal on the central bourse a fortnight ago. Its second series closed last week at 1,250 kuna per share in over-the-counter trade.
